versos: (syrian) 2 Kings 5:1 - "Now Naaman, captain of the army of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master and in high favor, because by him the Lord had given victory to Syria.";;;
(jew) Romans 1:16 - For I am not ashamed of the gospel
(strange) Proverbs 5:20 - "Why should you be intoxicated, my son, with a forbidden woman and embrace the bosom of a stranger";;;
(michael) "But even the archangel michael, when he was disputing with the devil about the body of Moses, did not himself dare to condemn him for slander but said, 'The Lord rebuke you'" - Jude 1:9;;;
(glorious) Psalm 111:3 - "Splendid and majestic is his work, and his righteousness endures forever.";;;

(corinth) 1 Corinthians 1:2: "To the church of God in corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus and called to be his holy people, together with all those everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christtheir Lord and ours:";;;
(calleth) Romans 9:27 - "Esaias also crieth concerning Israel, Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant shall be saved:";;;
(john) 3 john 1:9 - "I wrote to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves to be first among them, will not welcome us.";;;
(little) Luke 19:3 - "He wanted to see who Jesus was, but because he was short he could not see over the crowd.";;;
(lest) Matthew 26:40 - And he cometh unto the disciples
(driven) Genesis 3:24: "He drove out the man, and at the east of the garden of Eden he placed the cherubim and a flaming sword that turned every way to guard the way to the tree of life.";;;
(openeth) Psalm 145:16 - "Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.";;;
(breaketh) Psalm 46:9 - "He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.";;;
(eat) "So I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth." - Revelation 10:10 NIV;;;
(putteth) Psalm 146:9 - The Lord preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.;;

(aside) Hebrews 12:1 - "Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us,";;;
(curtain) Exodus 26:31 - "Make a curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen, with cherubim woven into it by a skilled worker.";;;
